items.title: A Russian YouTuber posts an unboxing of the alleged M5 iPad Pro, which looks identical to the M4 model; the same YouTuber leaked the M4 MacBook Pro in 2024 (Chance Miller/9to5Mac)

A Russian YouTuber posts an unboxing of the alleged M5 iPad Pro, which looks identical to the M4 model; the same YouTuber leaked the M4 MacBook Pro in 2024  —  Remember last year when an unboxing video of the M4 MacBook Pro leaked before it was even announced?  Well, it's happened again.

items.title: Russia hits Ukrainian city of Dnipro in rare daytime drone attack, kills one
items.summary: KYIV (Reuters) -Russia launched on Tuesday a rare daytime drone attack on the Ukrainian city of Dnipro, killing one man, injuring 20 other people, and damaging medical facilities and residential and office buildings, officials said. Read full story

items.title: Save $450 on Lenovo’s AMD-powered Yoga 7 2-in-1 14-inch 2K touchscreen Copilot+ PC while it’s down to $700
items.summary:
Alongside its now live Prime Day competitor sale, Best Buy is offering Lenovo’s Yoga 7 14-inch 2-in-1 Copilot+ PC down at $699.99 shipped. This is regularly a $1,150 notebook which is now seeing a $440 discount. We saw the 16-inch variant of this laptop with a Ryzen AI 5 340 processor drop to $550 a few days back, but this is the first time we’re seeing this 14-inch model with AMD’s Ryzen AI 7 350 chip drop this low. The same laptop, in case you’re wondering, is currently fetching its full price directly at Lenovo. Head below for more details.

more…

While it carries a $1,000 MSRP, this model has been recently keeping down at $900, with some falls over the year having seen things go to $850 and a one-time $841. The deal here today is going lower than ever, as the 22% markdown cuts $215 off the full price tag for a new all-time low. We’re also seeing discounts on its two upgraded models, which we’ve collected together below.

Lily Hay Newman / Wired:
Google launches a new AI ransomware detection feature for Drive on desktop, trained on millions of real victim files encrypted by various ransomware strains  —  Google has launched a new AI-based protection in Drive for desktop that can shut down an attack before it spreads—but its benefits have their limits.

items.title: Ring unveils lineup of 2K and 4K cameras supported by AI to interact with visitors and track down lost dogs
items.summary:
Today, as part of Amazon’s live 2025 device reveal event, Ring has unveiled its first-ever 4K cameras (and two 2K cameras) supported by AI for even more advanced security around your home. This is the most advanced lineup from the brand to date, with seven new models to choose from and AI support that helps to reunite lost pets with their loving families. These new devices capture critical details with precision, as the brand puts it: with “videos that look closer to what your eyes can naturally see.” Head below to learn more about this new generation of security devices.

items.title: Amazon just unleashed its new Blink 2K security camera lineup with Arc accessory for 180-degree FoV
items.summary:
Amazon has debuted a bunch of new devices as part of its fall hardware event, including a new lineup for 2K security cameras. Amazon’s security camera brand Blink will have two new security cameras up for grabs later today – the Outdoor 2K+ and the Mini 2K+, both with support for up to 2K resolution. Additionally, we also got a new accessory called Blink Arc, which will let you combine two Blink Mini 2K+ cameras into a single unit for a seamlessly stitched 180-degree FoV feed. The Blink Outdoor 2K+ is priced at $89.99 shipped, while the Mini 2K+ will cost you $49.99 shipped. Head below for more details on the new cameras as well as the Arc accessory.

items.summary:
We are now tracking a deal at Amazon that drops the 2TB Lexar NM790 Gen 4 NVMe M.2 SSD down to $109.99 shipped. This drive has recently sold for up to $160, so today’s deal saves you $50 off the usual price. It’s also $10 below its previous 2025 low, making it the year’s lowest price we’ve tracked. The NM790 is also available in 1TB, 4TB, and 8TB capacities, and they’re all discounted right now as well, with up to 27% in savings. Head below for more details.

items.title: Power your mobile life through Bluetti’s new RVSolar power system bundles with exclusive savings from $2,519 (Reg. $3,699+)
items.summary:
Bluetti is ending September with an all-new release for RV and van life lovers who want to adventure with a more eco-friendly power source – plus, we’ve even secured some exclusive savings for our readers. You can pick up the base package for Bluetti’s RVSolar 48V Solar Power System (made up of a power hub, LiFePO4 battery, and wiring kit) for $2,519.10 shipped, after using the exclusive code 9TO5TOYS10F at checkout for an additional 10% off. This new system will run for $3,699 at full price once the initial launch savings end, with things starting at a 24% markdown that combined with our exclusive savings for a combined 32% price cut of $1,180 that sets the bar for future discounts – plus, there are loads of bundle deals waiting for you below.

items.title: This originally $100 3-in-1 charging cube for your entire Apple kit is down to just $22.50 low today
items.summary:
LISEN 3-in-1 wireless charging cube

Buy for $22.50 (Reg. $40)

Enter promo code AEQKRK3Y for $16.97 off.

What we love

This multi-device charging station is designed to refuel your entire portable Apple kit simultaneously. When not in use, it folds neatly into a compact cube for easy storage. It features three wireless charging spots – one each for your iPhone, AirPods, and Apple Watch. As for the charging speeds, it delivers up to 7.5W for your iPhone, while the AirPods and Apple Watch pads provide 2.5W each. It may not be the fastest charger around, but we particularly like this model for its compact, foldable design, and budget-friendly price.

items.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered physical deluxe edition now live at $40 on Amazon
items.summary:
Considering how popular the announcement The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion Remastered was for 9to5Toys readers, we are doing something little bit different for this morning’s games post – the physical deluxe edition of the game is now live on Amazon for pre-order. While many expected the price to be much higher, you can now secure a physical copy of Oblivion Remastered on PS5 or Xbox Series X|S at $39.99 shipped – that’s less than the digital copy on the PlayStation Store. Now set for release on October 13, if you’re looking to secure a boxed copy for your collection, Amazon’s physical deluxe copy is now live with some extra goodies – a digital art book and soundtrack, new quests for a series of new armor, weapons, and horse armor sets, and the expected Shivering Isles & Knights of the Nine story expansions.

items.title: This 100W 3-port USB-C charger lets you tap into iPhone 17 fast charging for just $16 today (51% off)
items.summary:
INIU 100W 3-Port USB-C Wall Charger

Buy for $16.50 (Reg. $33)

Clip the on-page 45% off coupon.

What we love

This 3-port 100W INIU charger is a solid pick if you want a brick to tap into fast charging support for the latest iPhone 17 lineup. With enough power to also handle a MacBook, it can easily be the only charger you need on the go. It offers up a total of three ports, two of which are Type-C, and the other is USB-A. What we particularly like about this charger is that it’s relatively smaller than many other multi-port chargers out there, and it even ships with a USB-C cable.

items.summary:
Amazon is giving folks another rare chance to secure the official Samsung 3-in-1 Wireless Charging Station down at the $99.99 shipped all-time low. Regularly $150, and currently fetching as much straight from Samsung, this is only the second time we have caught a proper deal on this model. While Amazon’s offer is currently listed as “Temporarily out of stock,” you can still secure one at the discounted rate. These official steel Samsung charging stands have gone in and out of stock at Amazon more than a few times, and have been hard to come by on sale – it might be a good idea to secure one while you can.
